review_content: 330ml Flasche. Klar und golden mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Leicht getreidig, ansonsten sehr wässrig. Sehr leichter Körper. Quasi geschmacklos.

330 ml bottle, from Green Peas, Stavanger. ABV is 4.5%. Clear pale golden colour, moderate white head. Sweetish aroma of pilsener malts, starch, grass and candy. Fizzy mouthfeel. Medium sweet flavour with the same elements as the aroma, very moderate hops.

Bottle. Clear gold. White head.
Relatively mild lager, not much flavor.
Flat carbonation.
Not repulsive. Not great either.
Unnoticeable aroma, mouthfeel was weaker than expected. A below-average lager.
Sweet and light and crisp. Like a Busan autumn morning. Easy drinking but sucrosey. Perhaps the PBR of Korea.

This is not a beer I can highly recommend. Sweet, watery, and tasteless. Reminds me of a cheap American beer. On the other hand this beer could be a total life saver on a hot summer day. Very easy drinking!
Bottle from the Chinese Mini-Market on Gorgie Road, Edinburgh. Pours clear golden with no head. Aromas are metallic and sugary. Taste is more of the same. Watery finish.

Thuis uit een flesje. Nu allemaal niet zo mopperen hierop. Een fris pils met een laag percentage. Lekker voor de dorst op een warme dag. Ok, niet heel veel smaak en nasmaak. Helder geel, aardig koolzuur.

Purchased a six pack from my local 99 cents store. Short lived white head atop a clear, pale yellow body. It has a metallic smell, common with cheaply mass produced beer. The taste is bland and watery. Not something craft beer lovers should seek out.
Can. Sweetish, corn, lots of green apples, almost no bitterness, not crisp. Weak as expected.

Large bottle, drank on 11th Dec 2019 in a Korean BBQ joint, Irvine, Orange County, California. Light golden pour, snow white head, my oily and fatty mouth from the BBQ meats ensured it disappeared very quickly. Much preferred the OB Premier Pilsner I had before it. This was all corn and rice like in nature, poor fare to say the least.

Landje tick ... erg mineralig en kalkachtig, lichte mout, erg licht spul.

 Fles

Color amarillo, sin turbiedad, transparente. Espuma blanca de más de un dedo de espesor, un tanto irregular y corta retención. Aroma a cereal y notas de frutas blancas, sobre todo pera. Sabor a casi nada, ligerísimo cereal, sin amargor, sin posgusto, sin sensación alcohólica. Textura acuosa. Carbonatación media.

Más cercana a una gaseosa que a una cerveza.
Bottle shared with ShivanDragon, thanks! Sweetish with some malt, low hop profile. Medium body. Boring lager, few saving graces.

Botella @Mercado de San Antón, Madrid. 28/09/2019
Una mala lager industrial mas, importante Nuevo país.
330ml Flasche. Klar und golden mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Leicht getreidig, ansonsten sehr wässrig. Sehr leichter Körper. Quasi geschmacklos.

330 ml bottle, from Green Peas, Stavanger. ABV is 4.5%. Clear pale golden colour, moderate white head. Sweetish aroma of pilsener malts, starch, grass and candy. Fizzy mouthfeel. Medium sweet flavour with the same elements as the aroma, very…
Bottle. Clear gold. White head. Relatively mild lager, not much flavor.…
Unnoticeable aroma, mouthfeel was weaker than expected. A below-average lager.
Sweet and light and crisp. Like a Busan autumn morning. Easy drinking but sucrosey. Perhaps the PBR of Korea.

This is not a beer I can highly recommend. Sweet, watery, and tasteless. Reminds me of a cheap American beer. On the other hand this beer could be a total life saver on a hot summer day. Very easy drinking!
Bottle from the Chinese Mini-Market on Gorgie Road, Edinburgh. Pours clear golden with no head. Aromas are metallic and sugary. Taste is more of the same. Watery finish.

Thuis uit een flesje. Nu allemaal niet zo mopperen hierop. Een fris pils met een laag percentage. Lekker voor de dorst op een warme dag. Ok, niet heel veel smaak en nasmaak. Helder geel, aardig koolzuur.

Purchased a six pack from my local 99 cents store. Short lived white head atop a clear, pale yellow body. It has a metallic smell, common with cheaply mass produced beer. The taste is bland and watery. Not something craft beer lovers should seek out.
Can. Sweetish, corn, lots of green apples, almost no bitterness, not crisp. Weak as expected.

Large bottle, drank on 11th Dec 2019 in a Korean BBQ joint, Irvine, Orange County, California. Light golden pour, snow white head, my oily and fatty mouth from the BBQ meats ensured it disappeared very quickly. Much preferred the OB Premier Pilsner I…
Landje tick ... erg mineralig en kalkachtig, lichte mout, erg licht spul.…

Color amarillo, sin turbiedad, transparente. Espuma blanca de más de un dedo de espesor, un tanto irregular y corta retención. Aroma a cereal y notas de frutas blancas, sobre todo pera. Sabor a casi nada, ligerísimo cereal, sin amargor, sin posgusto, sin…
Bottle shared with ShivanDragon, thanks! Sweetish with some malt, low hop profile. Medium body. Boring lager, few saving graces.

Botella @Mercado de San Antón, Madrid. 28/09/2019
Una mala lager industrial mas, importante Nuevo país.

오징어 땅콩과 함께 무궁화호에서 먹으면 감성이 있어서 1점. 
Il n’y a acune arôme, ni de goût. Le goût de grains avec de l’eau
Very ricey in taste. Like water after boiling rice with a strange aftertaste.
Can from Søren & Siggi at Mette's. Pours a clear yellow. Dry with a light bitterness. Light aromas of pale malts. Also some gun-smoke hops aromas. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish.

Neus: graan, brood
Uiterlijk: helder gouden bier met ruime witte schuimkraag
Smaak: licht bitterig
Licht mondgevoel
Dorstlessend biertje indien fris gedronken.
Clear golden colour. Large white fluffy head. Good retention. Aroma: grains, bread. Similar taste. Light body. Low bitterness. Bland.
맥주 특유의 맛이 적습니다. 피츠처럼 아예 맛이 적으면 깔끔한 맥주이기라도 한데, 카스는 애매하게 이도저도 아닌것 같습니다. 그래도 친구들과 즐기기에는 나쁘지 않습니다.
Better than Hite, but still very simple. Just a beer. Once again better mixed with Soju.

Started drinking it in Seoul and kept up all over the country. It does exactly what it's designed to: non-offensive accompaniment to help even out spicy kimchi or banchan. It's as ubiquitous as Bud Light, but fresher, cleaner and less offensively bland. Comes in liter bottles, and the natives will have 2-3 with lunch. Not a terrible pale lager.
Cerveza de cuerpo ligero y carbonatación baja. Del aroma se perciben granos y algún toque de pera. En boca es una cerveza olvidable, con poco que destacar. Mas que una cerveza parece una gaseosa.

From a can on Asiana Airlines from NYC to Seoul....actually the cleanish pouring beer to date, no head, no nose and no taste . The nearest lager I have even tasted closest to pure water . Shameful. Quaff Score 0 / 10
From a can on a Korea Air flight. Pours a clear pale gold with a white head. Bready aroma. Flavors are sweet grain. Crisp finish. Totally unremarkable.
Really refreshing light lager, reminds me of a mild Sapporo. Crisp some bread.

bloody freash!!
Emo hanjan deo
best beer in the world!!
Bottle at Sing Sing in New Malden. Sweet and somewhat ricey lager. Not much hop character but drinkable enough.

Sampled from a can in Itaewon. Very pale yellow with a quickly disappearing white head. Some grain taste and notes of green pear and wet cardboard. A little bit of alcohol but no hop flavour. A very disappointing cheap lager.
여름 시원하게 쭉 들이키기 좋은 대한민국 대표 라거 맥주. 맥주 자체로 즐기기 보다는 음식과 페어링해서 먹으면 좋다. 특히 양념이 강한 음식.

This is not a beer.
It is just a water with some alchol.
Worst beer in my my life

Bottle at Gangnam

Pale clear golden colour, not much head. Sweet malty, a bit grainy, even alcoholic nose. Light-bodied. Fruity, green pear flavour. Crisp. Almost like drinking soda pop.

Poured from 11.2 oz bottle into pint glass. A thin white head falls quickly with virtually no lacing. Color is clear straw with mild streaming carbonation. Aroma of strong grassy hops and yeasty bread. Mouthfeel is thin and light. Flavor is mild -- cracker with some hint of grassy hops. Overall it is decent but just very underwhelming.

Geez, I swear I had drank many of these years prior and already rated this. From the bargain bin of my local. Chilled and into a tulip. Palest, yellow gold body and bright as bright. Headless bar an island of white suds. Boiled rice, starchy, boiled potatoes and creamed corn on the nose. Similar on the palate but absent is the creamed corn. Not much here. Peppery carbonation with a crisp, dry finish. No hops, no malt. Mild, stevia-like sweetness upfront. Light bodied but starchy and residual. Clammy as it warms. Really watery and thin. Got it out the way. Tick! (35,5cL can, BB 16/07/18, 1st Choice Liquor, Willetton)
This is a cheap lager in Republic of Korea. Not too bad, but not so good. standard lagers' flavor of Korea.
12 oz Can, poured into a pint glass. Pours a very light yellow with a cream head which dissipates very quickly. Your typical low cost lager, good on a hot summer afternoon.
Can thanks to Lore! Pours really pale yella. Faint nothong aroma. Carbonated and a bit like coors light, just sweeter. Thanks Andras!

0.33l can thanks to Lore. Pale yellow body with a white head. The aroma is quite unpleasant. It has faint notes of cardboard and grains. The taste is a bit better with notes of grain, corn syrup and metal. Not a good lager, but drinkable.
pale golden color, lots of corn and adjunct notes. Low bitterness. Cass without the C
Bottle 33ml. Small white head. Clear color. Aroma is leaves, sweets, earth, cardboard. Sweet taste
Bottle at Seoul Garden. Pale yellow with thin whit head. Mild carb. Very mild slightly grainy flavor. Innocuous leftover of German beer horizon

clear pale yellow 'beer' with practically no head at all, only some white spots on the top of it; aroma of hay, wet grains, cardboard and metallic notes; taste...well besides some sourish-malty notes, it has only an intensive disgusting artificial-like bitterness; practically undrinkable - goes to the plughole
Tastes like any number of generic lagers, leans toward the sweet side with a lot of carbonation.
Незапоминающееся пиво, на один раз. Подходит только для жары и острых корейских блюд.

Golden color, basically no head. Some very wired smell. Taste has sugar. Not much of aroma. High carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Korean restaurant, pours clear golden with white head. Aroma is malty, murky. Taste rather sweet. Little carbonation. That makes it a disappointing pilsener.
Bottle@Jespers - Clear yellow pour with white whispy head. Grainy and skunky with some rough grassy hoppy notes, some papery cardboard, very watery and vague hoppy into the close.

Sample from 33 cl bottle. Clear golden colour with a thin white head. Sweet aroma with grasses, perfumed notes, bread and grains. Taste is light sweet. Light to medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes drying with grains and pale malts. Ordinary industrial Lager.
33 cl. bottle. A clear yellow coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, straw and with a bitter finish.
Bottled. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of straw, and fruit. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw and metal, leading to a metallic finish.
33 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow. Small white head. Aroma is grassy and slight herbal. Herbal. Grassy. Straw. Bitter and strawish. Light herbal finish.

330ml can
Pale gold with big white head.
Grainy aroma.
Thin, grainy with a vague beer character.
Korea's No.1 beer. Why ?
Burk från kollega som var till Sydkorea. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Doft av bröd och citrus. Samma smak.

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle from 'Shochiku', bottled in July 2017. Clear, golden yellow with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish, a little grassy aroma of grains and some straw. Slightly sweet, moderately bitter, slightly grassy taste of grains and some straw, followed by a short, slightly bitter, moderately grassy and a bit metallic finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very bland, rather neutral, forgettable.

Can - 355ml. Pale blond, heavily carbonated body with an instantly fading, white bubbly head. Very thin malty/hoppy aroma with some bready hints. Its watery taste carries bready, malty, and some subtle herbal notes. Ends with a short malty finish. Perfect for mineral water drinkers.
330ml. bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma of corn. Taste of rice, citrus. Sweet, fizzy, poorly flavoured.
Just awful. Terrible i fact. A poor attempt at making fizzy water taste like beer. I'd rather drink Budweiser.

Simple Mart in Taipei City near the 101. Sure Korean beer is rubbish in general. No taste and nothing to write home about. But this one was a thirst quencher. It had a light grain and wheat flavour, which carried it beyond ordinary Korean efforts. It tasted like Super Dry with less flavour. But, it was so dry and easy to drink when ice cold then I would consider it again for the price.

24-09-2017; bottle; at home (bought at an Asian supermarket in Rotterdam, The Netherlands).
The beer looks very simple. The color of the beer is a very pale golden yellow. It is extremely pale. It is crystal clear, some little bubbles can be seen rising towards the top and on top of the beer there is some rough white foam. The foam disappears almost instantly, leaving next to nothing. Simple, boring.
The smell of the beer is of the same quality...simple and boring. With some imagination there are some distant aromas of sweet simple malts, some bitter hops, and some cheap sugars...maybe rice or something like that. Not good, to mild, to simple, nothing special there. A glass of water has more smell than this. 
The taste is a bit stronger, but far from good. It is overall quite mild. I taste some sweet extremely simple malts and a bitter taste that might be hop. It is a bit to sweet, bringing the beer out of balance. Meh. I have tasted a lot of better beers. 
The palate of the beer is average. Extremely light body, slightly sticky, high carbonation. The finish contains some hops, but not a lot of them. All in all, an extremely simple beer. It is way to watery. The taste isn't disgusting, but to thin, to watery, not good. I hoped for better beer.
Cam. Clear pale yellow color white coca cola head. Cereal aroma. Taste is lightly flavored water. Woof.

Pour is a highly carbonated very light yellow with no real head, pours exactly like a soda. Smells like light sweet corn and light beer. Taste is slightly bitter and carbonated flavoring. No aftertaste at all. Tastes like beer flavored water.

640 ml bottle from a Korean grocery store! Hell yes. Pours a clear yellow hue with a large white head. Soft fruity bready nose. Sweet, bready, toast, some paper, dust, pear. OK. Drinkable. Not bad. I'll finish this easy.
This is dishwater. Sweet dishwater. No taste, no funk, no yeast, no malts nothing! I drank it at a Korean restaurant. The food was great, the beer was awful.

Bottle at Irori in Steinbach, which has fantastic Korean food (and better beers than this). Clear body, white head. Grainy sweet bready. Inoffensive, but not much going on here. Might be my first Korean rating. I’m sure they have much better beer than this.
Well.. Not offensive.. But unspectacular in every way. Some apple and corn aromas and flavours. The Budweiser of Korea... Actually ab inbev owns this...so ya.
Bottle on Boracay. Bledo zlata farba, bez peny. Vona sladka, kukuricna. Chut sladova, sladka, jemne travnata.
Fles gedeeld met Roelzie1986. Het is een licht pils, weinig geur en smaak. redelijk waterig.
Entry level pee beer, as expected, but fun for a buck fifty pickup at a Sacramento market. Straw yellow, corn adjunct aroma and taste, no depth and watery and overcarbonated. Nothing to see here :)
Can at Inchon. Nose of corn, sweet mash, creamy. Very pale yellow. Lame, thin, sweet and grainy flavor. Almost no hops at all. Thick but watery, fruity and estery. Peaches, melon, orange notes. Yuck.

This is kinda tasty but not really well made. There’s a specific banana note to this which I associate with stressed lager yeast. It’s fine though. Nice and light with a ton of carbonation. Kinda reminds me of Miller High Life.
Clear pale yellow, short lasting white foam head. Malty aroma and light malty taste. It’s fresh indeed, that’s all. (Velp 201703)

33cl can courtesy og JMGreenUK
Thin white head. Slightly hazy pale golden pour. A bland lager.

F: big, white, good retention.
C: pale gold, clear.
A: typical macro, malt, light bread, grassy, floral, hint of caramel, light cardboard.
T: malt, bread, corny, sweet grass, hint of green tea, light to medium body, medium carbonation, very ordinary beer, 355ml can @ Incheon Airport in Seoul.

(En fût à BiergartenLA): Jus de lime et citron artificiel, extrême minceur du profil céréalier et du corps. C’est presque un radler tellement l’aspect orge est douteux voir inexistant. Très insignifiant mais pas imbuvable.
Rating from old records. From bottle into shaker. Fairly ordinary in all aspects

I’m rating this one purely for nostalgic reasons, having worked in Seoul for three and a half years. Back to back with ’Hite’, which is best? A small can from the local  Quan Lian supermarket. Aroma: sour grass. Appearance: clear, light amber, head dissipates to what looks exactly like mould in a petri dish! Light-bodied, thin texture, soft carbonation. Nothing happening at the end. Taste: lightly sour. You’d have to be desperate, and boy were we desperate?! Visitors to Korea, check out their semi-fermented rice wine - ’makkoli’ - a much better drink.

500ml from a Korean store down the road from Piligrim in Moscow. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is corn, paper, pale malt. Taste is stale malt, corn. Reminds me of the watery pale lagers that you come across in Vietnam.

330ml can (thanks Ares). Clear pale yellow color. Small size, white head, stays. Papery, plastic, corny, straw in aroma. Plastic, horrible acetone, corny, starch, sweet and papery in taste. I just brush my teeth, but looks like I have to do it again. Horrible brew!
Bottle. Pale grain and perfume aromas, light sweetness and some acidity, and a water feel. Drinkable, but I’ll pass.
Piwo o barwie zlotej bez piany. Zapach i smak lekko slodowy w porownaniu do poprzednikow brak metalowosci
Beer with light color, light body, soft carbonized, some foam in the top, (drunk from beer tower in Jeju,KR restaurant).

BB Apr 2017. Poured a crystal clear mid-amber with a one- to two-finger bright white foamy head that retained very well but laced poorly. Carbonation high, lively and medium to coarse. Aroma is lemonade like with sweet sugar, no obvious malt and no obvious hops. Taste is similar to aroma; like a shandy (lemonade+beer mix). Light body. Crisp, smooth and refreshing with a light sugary lemonade like finish.
Bottle shared with benzai... No head but leaves a small rim around the edge.. Clear yellow/golden colour... Smell faint malts yeast grassy.. Taste malts alcohol is almost not present but its fresh...

Bottle @ home shared by Thompson. Clear pale golden color, small white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, lightly rice, lightly sweetish, just the slightest hint of malt bitter in the finish. Well, when served cold enough it’s not bad on a hot summer day like today.
This is good! Much better than expected. Nice flavor, but also refreshing. Low alcohol content. Great with Korean bbq.
pours golden with an instantly vanishing white head. Completely gone, instantly. Smells kind of like an old sock in a new leather shoe. Tastes like sweet sugar and malt. Pass to laoshan.
355ml can. Pretty much your standard watery mass produced lager. Unpleasant aroma and a taste that mostly gets washed away.

Pours clear pale yellow with low white head. Aroma is slightly floral and has hints of citrus. Taste is mild sweet and slightly nondescript malty in the finish. Light sticky body with lively carbonation. A poor excuse for a beer.
330ml Flasche. Strohgelbes Bier, fast kein Schaum. Getreideduft mit Industrie Charakter. Wässeriger Geschmack. Etwas Süsse und Getreide.
水だけと、冷えてたからか、めちゃくちゃ美味しい
From a bottle. Not anywhere near as bad as I’d expected but that’s probably due to really low expectations. Had worse.
This is a typical macro brew. It is a bit too sweet, but is it works with Korean BBQ. Nothing really to say about it.
Fad. Mærkeligt at kalde noget bier når der rent faktisk kun er en hane, men oh Well. Dødsyg makrolager. Virkelig ikke noget at komme efter. Men en eating er en rating.

Aroma is that if cheap watered down piss. From a can smelled metallic and from a bottle smelled dank and poor. Color is similiar to Bud, but less head. The taste was like an artificial beer
flavoring (does that exsist?). Slightly malty, no hops apparently. After drinking it felt like I was going to get a headache.

12 ounce can


Most anything would be better than this sad imitation of beer. Even a shandy has more depth and richness. Fortunately it’s so bland that once you drink a few ounces to get a tick you don’t have to worry about it messing up your palate when you move to better stuff. 



Aroma / Appearance - A lifeless transparent body sits idly and flat in the shaker glass. Grainy lemonade renders the nose bland and forgettable - even a glass of apple juice has more character.



Flavor / Palate - Lemonade splashed with protein almost manages to provide a second of entertainment before the whole thing dissipates like a puff of smoke. A beer with flaws or infection might be better because it would actually have something to remember. Don’t bother if you have access to better South Korean beers.

66 cl bottle at a restaurant. Pale yellow color. Persistent soapy head, fizzy. Sweet grains and unmalted stuff. Sweetish taste, dusty texture, dryish finish. Watery texture, thin body. Very cold can be refreshing, at least.

Strange aroma for a lager. It’s definitely not as it supposed to be, but it’s way more interesting than other lagers. Has some winey, Belgian notes. Something went wrong with fermentation. Not that sweet. Smells actually quite pleasant. Taste? There isn’t any. Like a bit sweeter water with rather odd notes of old malts. Watery mouth feel. No bitterness at all.

Tasting at Matt’s
Pale blond color. Weird aroma, cheap but not bad. The rest is a shit trainwreck, soapy and unbitter, stale.
Bottle - Skunky euro pills. Pale gold with a decent white head. Light sweet with some skunk. As usual crappy lager.

650mL bottle, pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is quite sharp, with crisp herbal, grassy, skunky notes. Flavour is along the same lines, with the same, skunky notes and detergent. Really pissy, shit lager as expected.
Jaune très pâle avec presque pas de mousse. L’arôme dégeux des graines humides et peut être les vielles chaussettes. En bouche c’est meh. Les graines, et, est ce que c’est houblon? Hmm.
A horrific aroma of sweaty socks, pours a clear apple juice like color with a short lasting white head. Watery feel with no finish, a tinny flat funky taste.

Poured from a bottle. Clear light golden color, small white head. Light syrup and grain aroma. Medium body with a bad grain flavor and a shit finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle. I think the 1% rating is unfair. 2 or 3% at worst. Like a 40 oz. breakfast ale from 7-Eleven.
toast, golden, clear, minimal head, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, astringent, light sweetness, lightly bitter, woah.

Bottle to plastic cup
Consummation: A lemon, banana, and corn, hayfield.
Adjunct: Pepper, skunk, rice paper. Looks like piss.
Pale yellow appearance. Weak malty aroma. Thin and light bodied with a watery taste..

Visual: Pours ultra clear golden yellow with a decent creamy dissipating head, a thin half layer of retention, a few clusters of steady streams.

Nose: filtered apple juice, bready-grainy sweet barley malt. (lvl-5)-pungency

Attack: very crisp bite, tingly entry

Mid-palate: sparkling-fizzy, (lvl-3)-sweetness, (MAIN) red apple juice,  light liquid barley malt

Finish: burpy, off-dry light grainy barley malt, super subtle short-lived hops, some palate roughness as it warms.

Summary: Must drink extremely chilled. Initial sips are very refreshing but the enjoyability decreases exponentially as it warms and loses carbonation. Thin bodied and short length of flavour.

Bottle from a Langkawi night shop. Poured a clear straw colour with a thin broken white head. The aroma is light mineral malt. The flavour is light bitter with a watery dry malt, mineral light hop bitter palate. Light bodied with average carbonation. Very poor. Only drank this for the tick. Could not drink any more.
At Maakun’s, shared bottle, thanks! Pale gold with white head that dissolved quickly. Sweet malts, little grassy hop aroma. Non sweet, light bitter. Thin, watery, dry.

Bottle shared at home. Clear very light straw with short lasting white head. Very light taste with some sweet grains, paper and honey. Light sweet with barely any bitterness. Thin bodied with dry crisp feel. Very bland but not offensive though.
Clean, fresh, but ultimately just another boring pale lager. It’s drinkable, at least.

(355ml can, Beijing) Aroma: Lite nose, hints of yeast, dough, grass, sweetness. Appearance: clean, clear, pale straw yellow, light head that dissipates quite quickly, substantial visible carbonation. Taste: a bit astringent, a touch of grain roundness and sweetness, not much classic beer flavor, some window cleaner. Palate: very sparkly, some bitterness, lingering ’flavors’ on the inner cheeks. Overall: I’m not sure what to make of this beer. It definitely is fizzy/sparkling (as advertised). Probably an ok hot weather beach beer. My initial thoughts after one taste was ... average beer. But the more I keep sipping it, the worse it gets. Even on sale, I probably wouldn’t buy this beer.

Aroma.
Vainilla y hojas de te muy leves
9/10
Apariencia
La espuna desaparece rápidamente dejando un circulo delineando el vidrio del tarro. Cuerpo amarillo verdoso claro y bastante burbujeante. 3/5
Sabor
Ligeramente dulce. Medianamente amarga. Residuos umamis y muy ligeramente salados al final.
6/10
Paladar
Cuerpo ligero y aceitoso. Burbujeo ligero casi plano. Final ligeramente astringente. Deja dulce la punta de los dientes.
Conjunto
Si bien odio las chelas astringentes más que nada en este mundo, las saladas ocupan un segundo lugar en mi desprecio. Cass Fresh es salada. En principio el umami la hace interesante, pero es de esas cervezas que te dan más sed de la que te quitan. 
3/20

(can) clear very pale yellow colour with a tall, white head; aroma of noble hops, hint of skunk; neutral flavour, very little of it, no finish; if the idea was to create a beer with as little flavour as possible it is a success!

Bottle at a Korean restaurant. Pours clear golden with a very short lived white head and extremely lively carb bubbles. Aroma of grain, light malt and a light almost herbal touch. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with high carbonation. Ultimate refreshment with fizzy and crisp taste!
Gift from sandy. No aroma at all. Small head. Horrible taste, dirt and brome. Pour.
Bottle. This is a really thin and weak lager. It cuts through a bowl of ramen with ease though.
Pours a clear yellow gold from the can with little to no lace or head. Aroma and taste of sweet shitty malt and minimal fruity yeast. Wow, bud light Asia. Fuck this.

330ml bottle, 4.5%, BB Dec 2015.  Korea’s #1 beer.  Front of the bottle says this has a ’fizzy taste’, whatever that means.  Pale yellow, sparkling, clear, big foamy white head, light lacing.  Aroma is jeans, lemongrass, pale malts, touch of corn.  Body is light, foamy, soft tingly carbonation.  Taste is watery, diluted barley malt syrup, a little honey.  Very plain flavours, but at least it’s crisp and dry with a touch of hop bite.  Could drink four pints without noticing.  Humid as hell today, so a good beer for the conditions.

Aroma: No

Appearance: Quite little head, clean gold colour

Taste: Salty, hazy sweet of malts, no hop-bitter

Palate: Light body, thin rough texture, bombing carbonation, no flavour finish

Overall: So rough just like sparkling water.
Bottle at home from some asian supermarket. Light yellow golden beer, small head, aroma is hay, some malts. Taste is quite lemony, light bitter, some sweetness. Not bad, actually rather good
Had this "fresh" in Gangnam on a business trip at a Korean barbeque place. Tasted great with the food - light, drinkable, not much going on but in a good way. Nice pale lager - clean.

Bottle.

A- Lemon, corn, cereal.

A- Yellow golden color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Lemon, sweet corn, cereal, grains.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, refreshing finish.

O- My expectations were low not only because it was a import pale lager but it was over a year old. Just wanted the country tick. What a shock though! It wasn’t half bad, Lots of lemon and not the artificial abrasive lemon taste. Pretty refreshing. I don’t normally compliment lagers but if I’m ever in Korea I’ll have no qualms about drinking this one.
Brought back from Korea by my mate. Fizzy pale lager with almost zero taste. My first Korean beer, happy days!
Bottle. Faint metallic aroma. Pours golden with a small white head. Rice , metallic notes, bubblegum? Very thin with a watery finish. Not good.
Pours clear yellow with thin white head. Almost no smell. Light malty aromas. Medium carbonation, light body. Very short finish. Watery and insipid like most of industrial lagers.
Bottle->shaker at Bon Chon Chicken. Pale yellow with small white head. Piss water. Only good for washing down spicy food.

640ml bottle from a Korean supermarket in Chicago proudly proclaims this as "Korea’s #1 Beer: Ultimate refreshment with fizzy and crisp taste" Pours a clear pale yellow with big fluffy white head that never quite disappears, but doesn’t leave much lacing either. Aroma has grass, corn, and cardboard malts. Taste is on the sweet side, with no taste of hops or any bitterness in the finish. Body is light and watery with lots of carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel. It gets worse as it warms up. Overall, another boring pale lager which could have come from any country. If this is #1 in Korea, it suggests that Korean’s don’t have many good alternatives.

330ml bottle from a Korean shop in Düsseldorf.  Sweetish and very grainy beginning. Nearly no bitterness there, not even in the end. Lots of grain, moderate sweetish with an abrupt ending. Not deep. Strange brew. As there is no bitterness in the end (absolutely none), something is missing.

Drank this from a tabletop draft system at Beer King in Seoul, South Korea. Very light aroma with a little hay and almost no hops. Crystal clear straw under a pristine white cover that drops relatively quickly. Smooth light malt flavour that is slightly lagery, but with extremely low bitterness and hops flavour. Smooth, medium high carbonation, easy to drink, but extremely boring.
330ml bottle at O’Kims bar mild grainy aroma taste is crisp dry watery pretty flavourless overall
Light yellow pour, watery taste, overcarbonated crispy body, pale flavors of malts and corns, hop character is undetected, head disappears very quickly.

You know, I like some of those low-rated and thin beers. Beside a meal they sometimes are really fantastic and hit some points. This one not. It is thin. Ok. It is watery. Ok. But it also offers some skunk and the cheapest rice you may imagine in the aftertaste. Disgusting. Awful. No surprise, you see.

Bottle from Dae Yang in Düsseldorf. The beer has got a clear light golden colour with an low, airy head and medium body. Aroma of straw and caramel. Taste of mild hops, basement, grains and bread. Mild and grainy finish with an huge watery ending. You can drink it - but you won’t enjoy it.
Buvable, peu d’intérêt. Bouteille bue dans un resto coréen du 15è, Paris, France, le 20/12/2013.

Pours a really clear yellow color with a stale corn aroma. Taste is watery but clean and simple. A simple pale lager with no flavor our substance. Good beer for a hot relaxing day but that’s about it.

33cl Bottle from some toko at Kinkerstraat. Clear pale golden colour, snow-white head. Aroma of some sweet malts, light floral, rice, tiny hint of hops. Flavour is light to medium sweet, light malty, hint of paper, light lemon, rice, light-bitter finish. Fizzy, light-bodied. Not offensive, just not very tasteful or good.

Another tasty light linger out of Korea. Almost no aroma and color. Bouts almost clear with a white head. Had at Jin JU

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, gold pour, no head, nose is lacking, taste is lacking, smooth, bitter, crisp, perhaps refreshing.
Bottle at Korean restaurant. Poured light clear yellow min head. Aroma of sweet corn. Light carb thin bod. Bland sweet grain taste.
Drank this while stationed in Korea when i was in the Army, except it just said Cass, no fresh. Watery and sour after taste. I drank OB instead of this poor excuse for a beer.
355ml can from Carrefour, Xiamen. Pours pale yellow with a fast disappearing white head. Medicinal aroma. Watery sweet unpleasant finish. Not good at all.
Bottle. Slightly sour barley malt aroma. Golden yellow with minimal head. Slightly sweet barley malt flavor. Mild plastic in the finish. Chlorophenol issues but otherwise not horrible.

Bottle:
Clear, very light gold with a tall, quick, white head.
Honey/lemon, grain aroma.
Sweet grain malt....corn adjunct taste...very light.
Pretty plain, but no off-tastes a t all...
Not much to it, but not bad either.....

Drank from the can at Shanghai airport. It wasn't good at all. Worst than most pale lagers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear golden colored brew with some bitternesh, slightly better of taste than an "Corona". Works well on a hot humid summer day. Bought this beer at Amazing Oriental, the Hague.
Pours a light yellow color, small white head that dissipates quickly. Very little aroma at all, just a slight sweetness. Bland malty flavor with a bit of sweetness. Drinkable, but very plain.
Clear fizzy gold. A pretty standard pale lager, with a grainy malty base, low sweetness, and a touch of adjuncty corniness. Not bad.
Aroma is sweet malts and carbonation. Taste is water down malts and some bland hopiness that fades fairly quickly. Body is a clear gold with a thin head that retains poorly.
Straw yellow beer with white foam head. Light aroma of malt and corn. Not a great taste but a fine thirst-quenching.

Pours a clear golden beer, with small head and bad retention. The aroma has some malt notes like grain and cereal, but also some citric ones are felt from the hops. The taste reveals a light watery body with a sweet aftertaste and not too much hops.

Worse than Bud. Promoted as if on a higher level, to perhaps Heineken, but actually more like old Keystone light. Just look at the description - "Cass is a most distinguished lager beer." It is only distinguished by the blatant odors of corn and iron emanating from this beer upon opening. The appearance is of a somewhat darker urine, hence the 2 star rating there.

Drinkable only if ice cold and for the sole purpose of getting a hangover. Stay clear of this one if possible...

Pours one finger of head on a clear light gold colored body. Low head retention.
The aroma is metallic, adjunct grain and lemon. Not good.
The taste is boldly metallic and watery.
The texture is quite fizzy with a thin and crisp body.
This beer is completely not enjoyable.

Breaking my liver detox with a brief pale lager with my kimchi and korean beef burritos i made and after an 11 hr work day. 650ml bottle. Drank form the bottle. Smells and tastes like a pale lager, maybe the best out of korea

Bottle from oriental grocery in Bratislava.  Light golden color with medium white head. Lively carbonation. Old malt, corn, DMS in aroma. Sweet malty taste with corn and sugar. Bland, but quite drinkable if very cold.
Blonde pale, pétillante et mousseuse. Pas d’odeur, pas de goût, pas bon !

This is pretty much Korean Bud. Typical thin, fizzy lager. Drinkable very cold.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle from Little Bottler bottle shop. As far as pale lagers go this one was your standard amber lager with a pure white head, grain aromas and average flavour.

Bottle 330 ml 

 Aroma:  on dry side, prominent yet generic macro lager hop profile. Sweet sugary top. Quiet clean.

 Apperance:  poured as clean golden brew with large , snow white look. Very nice ornamental lace on glass walls. Quiet presentable.

 Taste/Palate etc.  light bodied. Easy going, we could say even bland still clean without any off flavours. Chalky hints. Mellow but not heavy. Solid refreshing choice for summer easy going days.
Can. Pours clear golden. Aroma of wet dog, cardboard and skunky. Light bitter and light sweet. Disgusting.

Did drink this in South-Korea in 2007. Hardly any maltiness, floral, slightly herbal hops, basement aromas, bubblegum, licorice, artificial, clear pale golden to yellow, lasting white head, light sweetness, very lightly bitter, light body, thin and watery feel, flat, some crispness, mildly bitter and fizzy finish
Can. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, pine. Flavour is fruit, malt, corn, hint of hop. Boring beer.

355 ml can bought at 759 Store in Sheung Shui Shopping Centre.



Piss pale golden yellow colour; One finger head and soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Minimal lacing and slight carbonation; Pungent smell of malt with light rice, corn, butter, hint of citrus and light grass; Mid to light sweet taste of malt, with strong rice, corn, wet cardboard, light chalk, light citrus and grass; Medium body, slightly oily and thick palate; Mouth feel is pretty good low sweet malty macro, but also full of rice and light wet cardboard; Hoppiness is faint citrus and low cheap grass in nose and taste. Not much for finish; Slightly dry after taste, very easy to mouth.



Comments: Thought this one would be as poor or sweet as fellow Blue Girl or Sonderberg, turns out it’s more like an average Tsingtao or typical Asian macros - low sweet half malt loaded with rice, wet cardboard that’s not annoying, and muted macro hops - good for washing down Korean BBQ dinners or any other heavy meals. Otherwise it’s barely passable.

Can 330ml.

[ Trade by jaghana ]. Clear medium yellow colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, fruity, light vegetables and corn - cooked corn. Flavour is light moderate sweet with a average duration, sweet malt - sweet corn, fruity, thin malt. Body is medium, texture is oily - watery, carbonation is soft. [20130628]

"brewed for mainstream beer drinkers looking for differentiated beer taste." I’d have thought they wouldn’t be. Anyway, this is not unlike those Japanese draft beers. Sweet, bready, a bit of that salty sake "Saint Marc’s pan" bakery flavour.
Can. Vaguely lagerish in appearance, with fine lacing and soapy head. Weak nose of corn and grains. Taste is sweet corn, grassy sticky malt. Fairly highly carbonated, and pretty damn awful.

Bottle. Sweet corny nose, pours on the darker side of golden, but extremely clear and almost incomplete at the bottom, medium carbonation with a sudsy bright white head. Very watery light body with less carbonation than expected, sweetness is very candyish and slightly floral. No bitterness, mostly clean. Does have a bit of verve in the effervescence department, I’d probably have it again depending on food accompaniment. [2013.08.02: 1.4]
Bottle in Korean Restaurant on Battersea Rise. Very pale colour almost no head. Nose is lightly fragrant, touch of floral, otherwise macro lager. Taste is crisp, little floral, very light in flavour.

Draught. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a small white head on it. Nose is slightly sweet (my colleague smelled vanilla, though I think she’s crazy). Taste and nose were much like a typical pale lager to me. Nothing special.
Bottle. Clear yellow with tiny head. Aroma is malt, grainy and cardboard. Flavour is malt, grainy, cardboatd, little sweet and watery.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and corn. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. Watery. 280613
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is yellow. Aroma and taste are sweet malt, straw and hops.

Another standard Asian lager, perhaps a little sweeter and fuller tasting than its South Korean companions. Substantially better on tap than in a bottle, easily found all over most of Seoul. Not bad at all with some spicy food or Korean barbecue.

Bottle (Everywhere, Suwon) (4:2:4:2:7=1.9)

Just another pale lager. Fairly clean, some gentle malts in both the aroma and taste. A touch fuller in taste than the gnats’ piss adjunct beers here. 

Rerate: 330ml can - thanks Marduk and Aresh! (3:2:3:2:6=1.6)

pale, watery, and chemical. ugh, bad pale lager.
On tap at 7 Bar. It pours a gold color with no head & a mild grassy aroma. The flavor was hay, grass with a mild bitter finish. Boring but ok cold.

Appearance: Clear yellow color with a white head.
Aroma: Sweet malty and artificial fruity.
Palate: Medium light body. A bit sweet and a light bitterness. Average carbonation.Oily texture.
Taste: Sweet malty and artificial fruity.
Overall impression: Had to drink it, as Trude carried this big plastic bottle with her from the other side of The World. Thanxxx a lot. I lied and said it was an ok beer.
Personal stats: Bottle from a kind and sweet Trude at work in South Korea. Enjoyed a sunny afternoon by the lovely Akerselva river in Oslo, together with Mr Visionthing and Mr Arve_Christian.

1L bottle (shared by Cunningham - thanks!) Pours pale golden with a white head. Smells like synthetic pear soda and stable. Taste a bit like pear soda too, or cheap shandy. Slightly unpleasant aroma. Light body and light in flavour. Doesn’t remind me much of beer, except for a very light bitterness in the finish. (2013-04-19)

Pours golden with no head. Typical lager aroma. Very smooth with a balanced flavor.  Probably one of the best lagers I have had. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On bottle with Cunningham, thanks. Golden color, good foam. Aromas of boiled vegetables, funny aromas- not much else. Light body & complexity. Poor beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 33cl @Paris Store France. A clear yellow beer, aroma is sweet with light malt notes, dusty hops, very basic lager not worst not bettre than any other industrial lager.

On draft at the Asiana Business Lounge at Incheon Airport in Seoul, had to have some authentic Korean beer (like it or not).  Doesn’t overpower the peanuts.  Actually, goes well with the peanuts.  Would not purchase.

Can aboard KE 17 from Incheon to Los Angeles. Very light grass aroma with some sweetish candy note. Normal pale straw color, lots of foam. Very very light balanced initial; goes a bit grainy in mid; final has small trace amount of grass and some sweet powdery flour. Thin-medium body. So mild and really just evaporates in mid palate. Sort of a candy beer and very fizzy. I wouldn’t have noted as much about it if I hadn’t been in a zoned-out state on a plane.

Pours a pale yellow with a white head and some light lacing. It has a light aroma of yeast and pale malt, with the same notes in the flavor along with a light body and a crisp aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ljusgul i färgen med luftigt skum. Doftar lite sött, ngn citrus lite gräs. Hög kolsyra lite majs, vattnigt.

Can sample at a tasting at kerenmk’s place. Thanks kerenmk. Pours clear yellow, aroma of honey, mat, grapes juice and and some floral notes, flavor of fruit, sprite, lemon, lively carbonation, light bodied

Tried this at a Korean restaurant. Pale gold pour with a thin white head. It had a weak grain smell, typical to a lot of generic beers of this type. Really lacked any discernible flavour other than a bit of sweetness. This modern and rebellious consumer says "No".
Korean water. Goes well with Kali or any other Korean barbecue. The gold standard for Korean piss lagers. Wouldn’t seek it out, but will never turn one down

640 ml bottle. Pours a light clear gold with lots of carbonation and huge head of large bubbles that settle quickly. Light aromas of cereal and honey. Absolutely no immediate taste. Some lingering  sweet cereal notes. Not offensive by any means - just nothing much there except the carbonation. A water substitute.

Can shared at a tasting in our place. Thank you Parents-in-law for this can! Pale clear golden with a white head. Malty and a tad bit sweet. Delicate, nearly tasteless, bitterness. Light body, abrupt finish, fizzy.

Can sample at a tasting at kerenmk’s place. Thanks kerenmk. Clear golden. Grainy aroma with a bit of hay and light grassy hops notes. Slightly sweetish flavor, pretty clean, finishes with faint bitterness. Light-bodied, a bit fizzy.

At a tasting, thanks kerenmk, smallish head, clear pale yellow colour, lighyt lemony flavour, light spice and herbs flavour with a hint of honey meduim bitterness and quite dry, a bit like soda water. Bland but drinkable.
The head is unrobust, the body yellow-gold. It smells watery a bit barley. The taste is watery, a little bit malty and sweet. Very boring. 7/5/4/5/7/5
Only got because of my friend named Cass. Not a great beer but could drink a lot.

The pour is an incredibly pale yellow with a short lived white head.  The nose is incredibly watery and bland.  Lots of fizz, cardboard, and paper to it.  Very light grain sweetness and no hops or esters.  The flavor is just more of the same.  Just kind of a wet paper feel to it.  Light sweetness, no esters, no hops, no yeast, and just a touch of grain.  Being very light and fizzy is about all this has going for it.

640ml bottle from cofco on 7/29/11.

clear yellow with a soft head.

it smells a little barfy... along with stewed veggies, paper bag and sulfur.

it tastes the same only more like tap water or the rinsing water at a tasting.

not bad...better than BL... it is crisp, fizzy and refreshing as stated on the label.3/3/3/3/9
330 ml bottle pours straw coloured almost light luminous yellow with white head. Strong yeasty malty nutty baking soda aroma. Nutty and pineapple flavour with strong yeasty malty aftertaste.

Clear pale yellow, small white head quickly fades. Mild corny grainy sweet lager malt aroma and taste. Some faint metalic citrus and minerals. High carbonation, light bodied, low hopped. Fresh, clean, thin and watery. Korean industrial swill for vivid, active, modern and rebellious consumers. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
Bottle from my favorite Korean BBQ joint.  pours pale yellow and tastes of budlight mixed with metal and water.  really not much more than seltzer but crisp and hints of beer taste

330ml bottle pours a pale straw color with a finger of white head that leaves very little lacing behind.  Aromas of mild hops and grains.  Taste is mild malt sweetness and light hop bitterness.  Light in body with moderate carbonation.  Although this lager has very mild aromas and tastes, it does have a fresh clean finish, but still not recommended.

Looks pretty thin, lemon pale with some white head and large bubbles. Some pale malt aroma, nil hops. Smells more like cordial than beer. Thin and actually rather unappetising. Not much to like. Beer in name only.
Lemony malt, cane sugar aroma. Clear yellow, thick head. Lemon flavor with very light malt undertones. Very weak and unbeery. A touch more flavorful than seltzer.
Same as all the other macro Korean beers; boring, light and easy to drink a lot of them.

0.33l bottle @ Hyundai Hotel, Ulsan South-Korea. Pours a crystal clear pale golden body with a thin bubbly and light sidesticking white lager-head. Light grainy and sweet on the nose with mineral tones. Not waay to exciting. Light fizzing on the palate with a watery mouthfeel. Mild is a good word here. Mildly grainy, mildly pale-malty and mild cardboardy with some mild hops. Perhaps even some mild cactus hints towards the mild sweet finish. Drinkable as a lager. Boring as a beer.
Pale golden lager, sampled in Seoul with EY. Anonymous mass produced lager.

330 ml bottle picked up in Sulaymaniyah, Iraq. Is a pale yellow color with a soft fast to go white head. Aroma is corn, paper, glue and carbon metals. Taste is tart sour glue with overtones of more chemicals. Palate is surprisingly smooth for such an awful beer. This is right up there with the US macros.
Can - Pours pale yellow, flat with no head.  very light sweet malt aroma.  Hard to pick up any taste,maybe a bit of alka seltzer.

Pours a very light yellow colour and the head does not stay for long. Not alot of taste, very generic mass-produced feel. Goes down very light, that is, it is quite bland and not light in a refreshing way.

330ml brown bottle. Pours out very pale yellow, very clear. Head is white and fizzes away quickly. Aroma has light hay/grass notes. Flavour of sweet grains, faint grass. No bitterness, dry finish, very carbonated and light bodied. Generic pale lager.

Super light clear yellow with a champange like head that fizzes out into nothing within seconds.  Stale, wet hay with some ocean water and a hint of minerals in the smell.  Taste is kind of like sucking on a wet cloth from a creek.  No real taste, but whats in there in not enjoyable.  Could this be worse than a bud light?  Yes, I think it just might be.

Well not much in the aroma. Just a hint of hop and a hint of grain. Pours pale yellow, no much head, lace, etc. Flavor is light, a touch sweet, a little grain, light hop, a little dry. Crisp, easy to drink. Not unpleasant.
Bottle. Splash of foam on opening but not a gusher. Almost no scent.  Almost no flavour.  Thin body.  Hint of Hop and fusal .

Bottle at bann. Pours a clear yellow with fizzy carbonated body and slight lacing. Aroma is light grain and almost nonexistent. Mouthfeel is thin with notes of rice, grain, plain plain plain. Nothing too offensive though.
Smells like a pale lager...hard to handle after an Arrogant Bastard. The flavor is very non-distinct. Not funky bad, but really nothing there. Not good.

Tap: I enjoyed this as a change of pace beer back the last time I was in South Korea, however this is very ordinary now. Poured golden clear color with white head. Aroma is gassy lemon. Taste is wet with not much substance, maybe a summer beer as it gets hotter instead of drinking water?

In one word: formaldehyde.

Far too carbonated, goes flat quickly. Has an incredibly artificial flavour, and sort of reminds me of liquefied Burger King french fries.

I don’t think this beer is as bad as its reputation, but I don’t think it’s good, either. It’s a bland, generally boring beer but wildly popular on the closed South Korean beer market. I spent two years in SK and the brand diversity i nonexistent.Sparkling appearance, no aroma to speak of, slightly malty taste. Synthetic taste to the back end.

The beer pours a pale gold and has much carbonation. It has a bland beer aroma. It has a surprising light taste and is refreshing when served cold, especially on a hot summer day in Korea. Best with Korean Food. Cass was originally brewed in the now defunct Crown Brewery before is was bought by OB.

No no no.  I like Korea food but I do not like any of the Korean beers I have had. This was a flavorless waste.  If I recall it is better than OB but worse than Hite. It washes down spicy food and that is all. At least there are no irritating flavors. Serving: Bottle

Light yellow colored, vanishing head. Thin lemony aroma with some estery note, not much to tell. Thin to medium bodied, carbonated palate. Flavor is watery with same lemon, some grassy-papery note also comes up.
Very light and watery. Not much to this beer but went well with some of the spicier korean food that i was eating.

Can 33 cl from Sun Wah in Antwerpen (B). Pale golden color, white head and very sparkling. Neutral odor, just smell of light malt. Tasteless, aqueous, keys of cereals, sugar and corn syrup. I even wondered if it was beer. Liquid bland and worst.
On tap at OKims Brauhaus, Seoul. Clear, pale golden, small head. Not smelling much, tasting just sugary water. Hard on carbonation. The blandest there is?
Bottle 330ml. Not my thing, insipid. Aroma is lightly malty; taste is sweet, with a dry finish. Thin and watery in the palate. Pale yellow, almost transparent, and head doesn’t last.

Poured from a can on a korean air flight into a plastic cup. 
Pale yellow, tons of head, very hard to pour mellow enough. 
Taste is slightly lemony, very weak in flavor, drinks like sugar water.

22oz bottle. Pours golden clear with a small fizzy white head. Aroma is of soggy newspapers, sawdust, and stale malt. Taste is of stale malt, sawdust, corn, and paper. This beer is truly awful. No redeeming qualities.
gold blond coloured body with a little white head a malty spicy aroma a spicy malty wattery taste with a wattery bitter finish
Yellow coloured beer with small white head and only few carbonation. Sweet grainy aroma. Full palate. Finish is bitter grainy ending dry.
Bottle thanks to my dad. Pours so pale it is nearly of Irish decent, small white head. Aroma of rice and sweet dough. Taste is grassy, bland, cardboard. Dry and fizzy mouthfeel.
Pale golden with a white head. Very weak aroma. Not much flavor, a bit straw and something artificial fruity stuff. Watery body, no bitterness and no finish...it is what it is...

When in Rome... Yellow body, slight head. Lemony nose with some straw. Taste was definately on the lemony side too. Palate so carbonated it makes your tongue sting. With all the spicy food I think its intentional.

My wife laughs at me because every time I try a new Asian lager I say the same thing "this tastes just like the last Asian lager I had".  At some point I’ll learn my lesson, but I guess I want to add another rating!

This beer is golden with a thin white head, with high carbonation, and a sweet corn flavor.  Nothing else needs to be said.

Oh, I guess it would go well with spicy foods...

this is very awfull.

pours a very pale yellow-white, with a very thin white head, and no lacing.

smell is weak, grain, some corn.

taste is water, weak grain, somewhat sweet, end is awfull.

Sweet malt nose, some vegetable notes such as corn. Some citrus like lime, cardboard.
Flavours are of a sweet malt. Hardly and hops and almost no bitterness. Mild citrus flavours with hints of corn or rice. 
Prickly mouthfeel, but clean and refreshing.
12 oz bottle from Chicago Food Corp.  Pours a clear hay yellow with a thin white head.  The nose says it all, old pale lager.  Old grain malt in the nose and an off dirty taste in the finish.

12oz. bottle in Incheon, South Korea.  Pour the typical light golden yellow, white head, minimal retention and lacing.  Aroma is all but non-existent, with light malt.  Flavor has no hint of hops, light malts.  Pretty weak beer all the way around, but the slogan "Sound of Vitality" is awesome.
50cl bottle in Seoul. Honestly not that bad or should say better than anticipated. Certainly nothing special but had a nice clean, fresh taste.
Another watered down Korean beer that I suffered through while I was there.  Better than Hite, but that’s not saying much.
Pale golden with a white head. Very weak aroma. Not much flavor, a bit straw and something artificial fruity stuff. Watery body, no bitterness and no finish.
Pretty good beer, fresh and crisp, nice to eat with, not at the bar. low level of head to offer, nice golden color, good with chicken particularly.

can - Hey, if I drink this beer I’m a cool young rebel!  Woohoo!  Ok, just read my ratings of Cafri and OB Blue, also from this brewer.  This beer is more of the same only it accomplishes the difficult task of being even worse.  I think the adjunct flavors are more noticeable.  It’s bad.  Just bad.

Canned, Light yellow coloured beer with average carbonation and a small white head. Sweet hoppy aroma. Medium palate. Finish is little bitter, with a strange sweet connotation, somewhat grainy and little sticky. Strange one.
It’s just there. Nothing to rate home about. Much better on tap than in can or bottle, but in Korea tap beer is usually watered down.
didn’t like this beer, had no real exact flavor. Bad Aftertase and lots of head. Tasted in Korea.

"Sound of vitality!" Umm... what? Another Korean delight in a plastic bottle. Golden color, pretty beautiful color actually, not as pale as you could imagine. Fresh aroma, nothing to do with malt though, smells kinda like mead. Flavor is rather sweet even with the lack of malt. After OB I was prepared for the worst, but this is actually quite drinkable. Tasted alongside Nøgne Ø Saison, Slottskällans Imperial Stout and Peroni Gran Riserva during Midsummer, and held up to them quite well. In fact, I might like to get some more of this if given the possibility.

Alas this is about as good as mainstream Korean beer gets a typical "fresh tasting" = flavourless thin & bodyless, I tried a lot during a 2 week trip to Korea earlier this year.  In this case it was the 500ml bottle version I rated. Cass is a Pale yellow lager with lasting white head. Overly carbonated giving a pronounced tingle with a malty aroma & a cabbagy touch to the flavour. it has a slight body but is still very thin. Tastes like its just unpasturised "Hite" to me.

Bottle. Slightly golden yellow colour with a loose white head that disappears fairly quickly. Aroma is faint but is chemical / cleaning solution. Watery mouthfeel with OK carbonation. Weak but awful flavour - fairly acidic with hint of malt and disinfectant.

Had this on tap while entertaining Koreans who wished to test their knowledge of the English language at the English Cafe in Seoul.  Standard macro nose of grass and sulpher.  Pours a fizzy pale straw with a quickly diminishing white frothy head that leaves no lace.  Non-descript flavor that would favor those who prefer mineral water.  Light watery body that is lively.  Glad I got this as a comp or I’d be pissed.  Nice to know that we in the states aren’t the only ones to suffer at the hands of the Macro-brewers.
I had one of these at a Korean bar before karaoke-ing Toby Keith songs.  It has some sort of flavor but the aftertaste is of packing materials.  I wonder if Fed Ex had a hand in brewing this...

Tastes slightly better than Natural Light.  Slightly better...

I second the chemical tasting comment and have found that all the Korean beers have a very synthetic quality to them.

This pale lager pours a light yellow gold color from a 330ml bottle. Small sized white foamy head. Aroma is cereal and citrus. Gee yet another fizzy light bodied pale lager, what a surprise. Kind of fruity and sweet, a little chemical tasting, but mostly nothing more than some corn sweetness and carbonation. No bad flavors, because there are almost no flavors here at all. Perhaps the best thing you can say about this stuff is light beer flavored water. Mouthfeel is thin and watery. Finish is crisp. Aftertaste is fizzy and sweet.

From bottle and Tap. Not bad. Pale yellow in colour. Chemical brew. Pretty much the 2nd beer in South Korea. Went down well after the first 3 litres, then better after 6, then 9. It was the only beer available!
From the bottle poured a dull gold color with a thin foamy white head.  No aroma.  Flavor was flatter than OB and in my humble opinion, not as nice.
I have thought long and hard about this rating im about to give.  I wanted to really capture the essence and overall feeling this beer evokes.   So, here is what I came up with:     blech.

22oz bottle via Lee.  Beer 4 of the Bartzilla’s Death Metal Beer Tasting 1/12/2007, consumed with many great beer drinkers including Bartzilla, Naven, as well as Lee creator of Arrogant Bastard.

This is terrible crap, but hell I’ve never had brew before from South Korea, and now I’ve had terrible nothingness from South Korea.  GARAGE.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with small head. Aroma of grains. Flavour is fresh and clean with grains and some hops. Thin mouthfeel. Hardly any aftertaste.

Can.  Water with a slight tint of yellow and a head that that was massive at first, but thirty seconds later was all gone.  The aroma is hard to pin down.  It’s a little like sugar, but I can’t really be sure.  There’s not much taste, but the little bit that’s there is making me cringe.  It’s like someone left an ear of corn in a 5 gallon bucket of water for the month of August.  It’s not totally tainted, but enough to make me want to yak.

Import bottle. 2nd of two Korean Heine wannabes in a row. Pours even apler than the O.B. Clingy bubbles, no head. Stale peanut shell smell. Taste, though is not as sucky as I expected. Admittedly fizzy, which covers the adjunct taste. Lets some maltiness through, and a bit of bitterness. So yeah, it does have its points. Not a lot, but there you go.

I tried this from the bottle when at a Korean restaurant to simply broaden my beer experiences. Enjoying many other asian beers (Tiger, Bintang) I thought it would again be a light, crisp ale. I can’t give this beer anything more than a 1 for flavour - because in my opinion it is the weakest beer, flavour wise I have tried. Checking the ingrediants, they did use just the core-four ingrediants. I swear they missed the malt out.
Just another plain lager that tastes pretty much the same as other lagers.  Decent, for what it was but nothign spectacular.  Just a SK version of a general macro.

Typical pale lager with its sweet malt and corn adjuncts in abundance.   Very spritzy mouthfeel.  As a rebellious and vivid consumer I applaude  most distinguished Cass Fresh and it’s active sound of modern vitality.

Very pale yellow body with a small fizzy head.  Faint aroma of sweet malt and corn.  Highly carbonated with a light malt flavoring and a dab of hop bitterness.  Drinkable

Cardinal Wine & Spirits, Hoffman Estates, IL

Bottled. Pours a really light yellow color. Aroma is watered down grain. Very light malty flavor. Not horrible, but it tastes like corn flavored mineral water. Slightly bitter finish. Overly carbonated as well.
Bottle.  Light yellow with a foamy head.  Standard corn flavors with faint hops and a slight citrus note.  Next.

A very weak pale lager, water flavored beer at best.  Corn and wet cardboard dominate the flavor.  Fizzy yellow, heavy carbonation.  Bland and boring, not the worst I have had, but just has nothing to it in the flavor or body department.

Of the three Korean beers (OB, Hite, and this) I bought, this was the lowest. Too much carbonation, a very faint corn taste; it’s like drinking soda...for me, I was able to sup it down. An average lager.
very crisp, like i guess what bud and miller are crying about back in the states.  Im not a fan at all, its infereier to hite and really lacks in the satisfaction department.

I had this with some fantastic Korean food at Ararang in Perth. I had this beer following a Hite pale lager, and I must say that this was definitely the better of the two, although it was still a weak pale lager by any standard. Just read my Hite beer rating-- it all applies here too. Add an extra point for the wisp of citrus and the inkling of malt that can be found. VERY carbonated!
On tap in Seoul.  Probably the best of the Korean beers.  None of them were really anything to write home about,  Just eat some spicy Korean food and wash it down with this and you’ll be OK!
I prefer this to the other commercial beers in Korea, but none of them are particularly memorable.

Look, Korea isn’t known for it’s abillity to make decent beers, and this one just proves it’s point. It is a smooth beer, but the lack of taste and body makes it almost unbearable. The only thing it has going for is it is cheap. Damn cheap.

Innoffensive lawnmower beer that needs to warm up a bit to release what little flavour exists. Great smooth easy-drinking body though, let down only by it’s burpiness. Details: Very pale crystal clear w big sudsy head from the pour that dropped to 3mm - lotsa teensy quick bubbles all through. While this had much more aroma than "Asahi Dry" I only found a sweet citrus hint and a little hops. Alarmingly, the bottle proclaims it is "cold filtered for a smooth refreshing taste". Instead there was no taste to speak of: maybe a tiny bit of malt - quite an achievement to get no taste. I ate some of the "head" after repouring - it tasted mildly lemony. The texture was surprisingly smooth with a watery body that melted away. A slight edge from a little overcarbonation making it burpy (burps are only good when the beer has taste). Clean finish which is strangely clingy considering there’s no taste to cling! Palate cleanser chilled. Improve it with food: hamburgers, Thai, Korean, peppery cheeses, sushi, fish or maybe BBQ. Luke said it was like watered down Export Gold.

(re-rate)  I’m in Korea right now so this stuff is pretty fresh... in the sense that it was bottled recently and didn’t have to travel far.  However, I guess they just make it skunky.  Overwelming rancid odour upon opening the bottle.  Pours with very little head with a pale pale straw colour.  Thin body with lots of carbonation.  The only redeeming quality is that it has a clean aftertaste.  Cheers!
Pale straw color with decent white head.  No hoppiness or maltiness in aroma or flavor.  Highly carbonated.  Not a big fan of the Asian lagers, and this one is on the low end.  Just nothing there.

Can. On the plane. Pretty horrifically crap stuff. Very low on flavour, with some ricey adjuncty type flavours. There was a few other beers on the plane i hadn’t tried, but this kinda put me off rating them and so i didn’t and so i missed out on 3 ratings, and i didn’t really care.

(Bottle 50 cl) Golden with a pretty much non-existing head. Nice hoppines in the nose to begin with, but this fades fast. Apparently the hops are for the scent only, there’s absolutely no trace of them on the palate. Light and fresh (as promised but extremely watery. High on carbonation. 250303
Looks and smells like your bog standard pale larger. Palate offers some differentiation though; quite soft with reaonably appealing sweet notes. Has some quaffability but not much more.

This is one of maybe four readily available beers here in Korea.  The others are OB (also brewed by this brewery, in fact it’s their flagship), Cafri, Hite, and Hite Prime.  All of them are pretty nasty and watery.  A very skunky aroma, full of cheap sugars.  Available, notably, in the plastic 1.2 liter ’pitchers’.
Bland, quite bland. Light on the malt (and probably fermented with a lot of sugars). Light on the hops. Also lacked gassing and head, which was a disappointment.

Light gold.  Smells rancid, fortunately tastes less than rancid.  Reasonably decent,. certainly plenty of adjuncts.  OK with Korean barbeque, though the Surgeon General recommends this beer not be drunk by overweight folk singers, particularly while eating a ham sandwich.
